29   package org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.external.samples;
30   
31   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.TeleOp;
32   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.Disabled;
33   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode;
34   
35   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.ClassFactory;
36   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.WebcamName;
37   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices.OpenGLMatrix;
38   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices.VectorF;
39   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngleUnit;
40   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesOrder;
41   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesReference;
42   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.Orientation;
43   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.RelicRecoveryVuMark;
44   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.VuMarkInstanceId;
45   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.VuforiaLocalizer;
46   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.VuforiaTrackable;
47   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.VuforiaTrackableDefaultListener;
48   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.VuforiaTrackables;
49   
50   /**
51    * This OpMode illustrates the basics of using the Vuforia engine to determine
52    * the identity of Vuforia VuMarks encountered on the field. The code is structured as
53    * a LinearOpMode. It shares much structure with {@link ConceptVuforiaNavigationWebcam}; we do not here
54    * duplicate the core Vuforia documentation found there, but rather instead focus on the
55    * differences between the use of Vuforia for navigation vs VuMark identification.
56    *
57    * @see ConceptVuforiaNavigationWebcam
58    * @see VuforiaLocalizer
59    * @see VuforiaTrackableDefaultListener
60    * see  ftc_app/doc/tutorial/FTC_FieldCoordinateSystemDefinition.pdf
61    *
62    * Use Android Studio to Copy this Class, and Paste it into your team's code folder with a new name.
63    * Remove or comment out the @Disabled line to add this opmode to the Driver Station OpMode list.
64    *
65    * IMPORTANT: In order to use this OpMode, you need to obtain your own Vuforia license key as
66    * is explained in {@link ConceptVuforiaNavigationWebcam}.
67    */
68   
69   @TeleOp(name="Concept: VuMark Id Webcam", group ="Concept")
70   @Disabled
71   public class ConceptVuMarkIdentificationWebcam extends LinearOpMode {
72   
73       public static final String TAG = "Vuforia VuMark Sample";
74   
75       OpenGLMatrix lastLocation = null;
76   
77       /**
78        * {@link #vuforia} is the variable we will use to store our instance of the Vuforia
79        * localization engine.
80        */
81       VuforiaLocalizer vuforia;
82   
83       /**
84        * This is the webcam we are to use. As with other hardware devices such as motors and
85        * servos, this device is identified using the robot configuration tool in the FTC application.
86        */
87       WebcamName webcamName;
88   
89       @Override public void runOpMode() {
90   
91           /* 
92            * Retrieve the camera we are to use. 
93            */
94           webcamName = hardwareMap.get(WebcamName.class, "Webcam 1");
95   
96           /* 
97            * To start up Vuforia, tell it the view that we wish to use for camera monitor (on the RC phone); 
98            * If no camera monitor is desired, use the parameterless constructor instead (commented out below). 
99            */
100          int cameraMonitorViewId = hardwareMap.appContext.getResources().getIdentifier("cameraMonitorViewId", "id", hardwareMap.appContext.getPackageName());
101          VuforiaLocalizer.Parameters parameters = new VuforiaLocalizer.Parameters(cameraMonitorViewId);
102  
103          // OR...  Do Not Activate the Camera Monitor View, to save power
104          // VuforiaLocalizer.Parameters parameters = new VuforiaLocalizer.Parameters();
105  
106          /* 
107           * IMPORTANT: You need to obtain your own license key to use Vuforia. The string below with which 
108           * 'parameters.vuforiaLicenseKey' is initialized is for illustration only, and will not function. 
109           * A Vuforia 'Development' license key, can be obtained free of charge from the Vuforia developer 
110           * web site at https://developer.vuforia.com/license-manager. 
111           * 
112           * Vuforia license keys are always 380 characters long, and look as if they contain mostly 
113           * random data. As an example, here is a example of a fragment of a valid key: 
114           *      ... yIgIzTqZ4mWjk9wd3cZO9T1axEqzuhxoGlfOOI2dRzKS4T0hQ8kT ... 
115           * Once you've obtained a license key, copy the string from the Vuforia web site 
116           * and paste it in to your code on the next line, between the double quotes. 
117           */
118          parameters.vuforiaLicenseKey = " -- YOUR NEW VUFORIA KEY GOES HERE  --- ";
119  
120  
121          /**
122           * We also indicate which camera on the RC we wish to use. For pedagogical purposes,
123           * we use the same logic as in {@link ConceptVuforiaNavigationWebcam}.
124           */
125          parameters.cameraName = webcamName;
126          this.vuforia = ClassFactory.getInstance().createVuforia(parameters);
127  
128          /**
129           * Load the data set containing the VuMarks for Relic Recovery. There's only one trackable
130           * in this data set: all three of the VuMarks in the game were created from this one template,
131           * but differ in their instance id information.
132           * @see VuMarkInstanceId
133           */
134          VuforiaTrackables relicTrackables = this.vuforia.loadTrackablesFromAsset("RelicVuMark");
135          VuforiaTrackable relicTemplate = relicTrackables.get(0);
136          relicTemplate.setName("relicVuMarkTemplate"); // can help in debugging; otherwise not necessary
137  
138          telemetry.addData(">", "Press Play to start");
139          telemetry.update();
140          waitForStart();
141  
142          relicTrackables.activate();
143  
144          while (opModeIsActive()) {
145  
146              /**
147               * See if any of the instances of {@link relicTemplate} are currently visible.
148               * {@link RelicRecoveryVuMark} is an enum which can have the following values:
149               * UNKNOWN, LEFT, CENTER, and RIGHT. When a VuMark is visible, something other than
150               * UNKNOWN will be returned by {@link RelicRecoveryVuMark#from(VuforiaTrackable)}.
151               */
152              RelicRecoveryVuMark vuMark = RelicRecoveryVuMark.from(relicTemplate);
153              if (vuMark != RelicRecoveryVuMark.UNKNOWN) {
154  
155                  /* Found an instance of the template. In the actual game, you will probably 
156                   * loop until this condition occurs, then move on to act accordingly depending 
157                   * on which VuMark was visible. */
158                  telemetry.addData("VuMark", "%s visible", vuMark);
159  
160                  /* For fun, we also exhibit the navigational pose. In the Relic Recovery game, 
161                   * it is perhaps unlikely that you will actually need to act on this pose information, but 
162                   * we illustrate it nevertheless, for completeness. */
163                  OpenGLMatrix pose = ((VuforiaTrackableDefaultListener)relicTemplate.getListener()).getFtcCameraFromTarget();
164                  telemetry.addData("Pose", format(pose));
165  
166                  /* We further illustrate how to decompose the pose into useful rotational and 
167                   * translational components */
168                  if (pose != null) {
169                      VectorF trans = pose.getTranslation();
170                      Orientation rot = Orientation.getOrientation(pose, AxesReference.EXTRINSIC, AxesOrder.XYZ, AngleUnit.DEGREES);
171  
172                      // Extract the X, Y, and Z components of the offset of the target relative to the robot
173                      double tX = trans.get(0);
174                      double tY = trans.get(1);
175                      double tZ = trans.get(2);
176  
177                      // Extract the rotational components of the target relative to the robot
178                      double rX = rot.firstAngle;
179                      double rY = rot.secondAngle;
180                      double rZ = rot.thirdAngle;
181                  }
182              }
183              else {
184                  telemetry.addData("VuMark", "not visible");
185              }
186  
187              telemetry.update();
188          }
189      }
190  
191      String format(OpenGLMatrix transformationMatrix) {
192          return (transformationMatrix != null) ? transformationMatrix.formatAsTransform() : "null";
193      }
194  }
195
